The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in tundra or mountainous habitats. Abildgaardia papillosa plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native ecosystems and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations to extreme climates.
